column1: Acajete Municipality is a municipality located in the central zone in the state of Veracruz
column2: about 20 km from state capital Xalapa. It has a surface of 90.48 km2. It is located at 19°58′N 97°00′W. In the middle of 1586 this village was formed
column3: on one of the adjoining old men of Tlacolulan's dominion. The decree N ° 64 of November 3
column5: extinguished the municipality of La Hoya
column6: annexing its territory to San Salvador Acajete. On November 5
column8: the municipal head-board San Salvador Acajete changes the name to Acajete.

column1: Acajete Municipality is delimited to the north by Tlacolulan and Las Vigas de Ramírez to the east by Rafael Lucio
column2: to the south by Tlalnelhuayocan and to the west by Perote. It is watered by affluent creeks of the Río Sedeño
column3: which are tributaries of the Actopan. The principal creek is the Pixquiac.

column2: in August takes place the celebration in honor to San Salvador
column4: and in December takes place the celebration in honor to Virgen de Guadalupe.

column2: due to its high altitude (2023 m or 6637 ft.)
column3: Acajete features a humid subtropical highland climate (Köppen climate classification: Cfb).
